Uses of Package
ca.uqac.lif.cep.epl

  • Packages that use ca.uqac.lif.cep.epl 
    Package Description
    ca.uqac.lif.cep.cli
    Rudimentary interactive command-line interpreter and GUI.
    ca.uqac.lif.cep.epl
    Processors to manipulate traces of generic events.
    ca.uqac.lif.cep.io
    Processors to handle input and output of data from external sources, such as files and pipes.
    ca.uqac.lif.cep.tuples
    Processors and functions for event traces made of tuples of name-value pairs.
  • Classes in ca.uqac.lif.cep.epl used by ca.uqac.lif.cep.cli 
    Class and Description
    Sink
    Receives input events and stores them.
  • Classes in ca.uqac.lif.cep.epl used by ca.uqac.lif.cep.epl 
    Class and Description
    CountDecimate
    Returns one input event and discards the next n-1.
    Dropper
    Takes a set of elements as input, and returns as many output events as there are elements in that set.
    Filter
    Discards events from an input trace based on a selection criterion.
    Freeze
    Repeatedly outputs the first event it has received.
    Insert
    Inserts an event a certain number of times before letting the input events through.
    NaryToArray
    Converts n input traces into a single output trace, whose events are arrays of n elements
    QueueSink
    Sink that accumulates events into queues.
    QueueSource
    Source whose input is a queue of objects.
    Sink
    Receives input events and stores them.
    SinkLast
    Sink that remembers only the last event sent to it.
    Slicer
    Separates an input trace into different "slices".
    Slicer.AllSlices
    Dummy object telling the slicer that the event must be sent to all slices
    Source
    Produces output events from no input.
    Splicer
    Joins multiple traces as a single one.
    StateSlicer
    Separates an input trace into different "slices".
    StateSlicer.ToAllSlices
    Dummy object telling the slicer that an event must be sent to all slices
    TimeDecimate
    After returning an input event, discards all others for the next n seconds.
    Trim
    Discards the first n events of the input, and outputs the remaining ones.
    Window
    Simulates the application of a "sliding window" to a trace.
    WindowFunction
    Takes a sliding window of n successive input events, passes them to an n-ary function and outputs the result.
  • Classes in ca.uqac.lif.cep.epl used by ca.uqac.lif.cep.io 
    Class and Description
    Sink
    Receives input events and stores them.
    Source
    Produces output events from no input.
  • Classes in ca.uqac.lif.cep.epl used by ca.uqac.lif.cep.tuples 
    Class and Description
    Source
    Produces output events from no input.
